page.title: 13SMUGGLERS
page.content: Further along the High Street are a row of thatched cottages.These used to be the headquarters of a smuggler named Charles Weeks around 1720.He smuggled in various goods along the Dorset Coast and hid them in Winfrith before sending them onto merchants in London. Many of the older houses in the village are built of cob(chalk,clay and straw)and have thatched roofs There are 53 thatched roofs in Winfrith.The village is now in a Conservation Area.Several older properties are restored by the Old Buildings Preservation and Restoration Trust.As the village is also on Dorset County Council's List for development several new houses have been built. care has been taken to fit them into the village style of architecture.
